result.execSummary:
The defendant JUSTIN X HERNANDEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Child Custody [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

1:12 PM Defendant JUSTIN X HERNANDEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JUSTIN X HERNANDEZ on 2021CF55. Atty Jeanne Zamzow in court for Justin Hernandez on 2022CF15.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2021CF55 & 2022CF15. Court recites plea agreement on 2021CF55, defendant will plea to the charge with jail, costs and DNA sample. DA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs. Court recites agreement on 2022CF15, defendant will plea to counts 1, 3 &4 with jail, costs and DNA sample and defense is free to argue. DA concurs. Atty Zamzow concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaires with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeater. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to 2021CF55 and GUILTY to counts 1,3 & 4 on 2022CF15. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty in 2021CF55 on count 1 as charged. Court finds the defendant guilty in 2022CF15 on count 1, 3 and 4 as charged. Court orders counts 2 & 5 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF55

-4 months county jail. Court grants huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2022CF15

Count 1 
-9 months county jail, concurrent to each other but consecutive to 21CF55. Court grants huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Count 3
-9 months county jail, concurrent to each other but consecutive to 21CF55. Court grants huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Count 4
-9months county jail concurrent to each other but consecutive to 21CF55. Court grants huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA sample.

Court grants the defendant 308 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:40 PM

Per Lori in the jail - 90 days credit on 2021CF55 and 218 days credit on 2022CF15.

9:51 AM Defendant JUSTIN X HERNANDEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF15. Atty Michael Kapelis is present and represents the defendant on 2021CF55. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant will proceed with arraignment without counsel. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Court goes over maximum penalties. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty. 

Court adjourned at 9:54 AM

Court will set both cases for Return Date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Arraignment on March 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:42 AM Defendant JUSTIN X HERNANDEZ appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Def request to  have preliminary hearing today. DA Laspisa has one witness. 

Jessica Schroeder sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed with the Berlin Police Department as Corporal Investigator. Was employed at the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present by zoom. No cross by the defendant.  No other witnesses or evidence by the State. No witnesses by the def.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court will set for Arraignment for March 23, 2022 at 9:45 AM.  21CF55 to track.

Court adjourned at 10:52 AM.
